evals.name: strong-match-light-tailoring
evals.prompt: I just evaluated that VP of Engineering role at HealthFirst — it scored 'strong'. Go ahead and tailor my resume for it.
evals.expected_output: Light tailoring: keyword injection, bullet reordering, minimal structural changes. All three files produced (.md, .docx, .pdf). metadata.json updated with resume_version.
evals.context: Application folder exists at applications/2026-02-24_healthfirst_vp-engineering/ with metadata.json showing overall: strong, keywords including value-based care, AI/ML, HL7/FHIR, HIPAA, AWS.

assertions.text: Creates resume.md, resume.docx, and resume.pdf in the application folder
Updates metadata.json with resume_version field pointing to the resume filename
Uses light tailoring — same overall structure as base resume, no section reordering or major rewrites
Job posting keywords (value-based care, AI/ML, HL7/FHIR, HIPAA) appear naturally in the tailored resume
Every bullet traces to either base-resume.docx or achievements.md — nothing invented
Presents a summary of what changed and why, including tailoring intensity used

evals.name: stretch-match-heavy-tailoring
evals.prompt: That DevOps Platform Lead role at Netflix scored 'stretch' but I still want to give it a shot. Tailor my resume — make it as strong as possible.
evals.expected_output: Heavy tailoring: rewritten summary targeting DevOps/platform engineering, experience reordered to lead with most relevant roles, multiple achievements pulled from achievements.md, honest note about remaining gaps. All three files produced.
evals.context: Application folder exists with metadata.json showing overall: stretch, gaps including 'streaming infrastructure experience' and 'dedicated DevOps leadership role', partial matches on CI/CD and cloud. Keywords: Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD, platform engineering, SRE, observability.

assertions.text: Creates resume.md, resume.docx, and resume.pdf in the application folder
Uses heavy tailoring — rewritten summary, reordered bullets, possibly reordered sections
Adds achievements from achievements.md that aren't on the base resume (e.g., CI/CD and DevOps items from Red Spot)
Notes remaining hard gaps in the change summary rather than pretending they don't exist
Every bullet traces to either base-resume.docx or achievements.md — nothing invented
Recommends cover letter to address remaining gaps and asks if user wants to proceed to cover-letter-writer

evals.name: former-employer-light-override
evals.prompt: Tailor my resume for the Cognizant Chief Architect role. That's my old company so you know the deal.
evals.expected_output: Light tailoring despite any match score because former_employer is true. Resume emphasizes what candidate has done SINCE Cognizant, not the Cognizant experience itself. Avoids over-tailoring.
evals.context: Application folder exists with metadata.json showing former_employer: true, former_employer_role: 'Chief Technology Architect', overall: strong.

assertions.text: Creates resume.md, resume.docx, and resume.pdf in the application folder
Uses light tailoring because this is a former employer, regardless of match score
Emphasizes experience gained AFTER leaving Cognizant (ilumed, Perceptive) rather than over-detailing the Cognizant tenure
Summary or positioning acknowledges the return — something like 'returning with expanded scope' rather than hiding the connection
Does not heavily restructure or rewrite — the resume stays recognizable and doesn't look like it was over-engineered for a place that already knows the candidate
